subject: SCI
title: Physics, the Universe, and Everything
description: How does the universe work? How can it even exist? What is the ultimate nature of reality? This course explores big picture questions that connect humanity to the nature of the physical world. Beginning with introduction to Einstein's ideas and the quantum nature of the universe, this course considers how physicists tackle some of the mysteries (e.g., existence itself) and challenges (e.g., the world's energy problem) in science today. [Note: No mathematics or other specialized knowledge is required; students from non-science faculties are encouraged to attend. Offered: W]
